website_summaries.verdict: The Nike Zoom Fly 3 enjoys its fair share of positive reviews from consumers. Its quality is mostly held in high regard, save for the outsole which is apparently quick to wear off. Furthermore, the performance of the midsole has its critics, with some stating that the underfoot experience is a bit too soft for extended runs. But the same part also savors praise from those who like its push-off power. The design is also noticed by admiring eyes.Fans of road running shoes who are neutral pronators are the target market of the Nike Zoom Fly 3.
pros: Several testers claim that the Zoom Fly 3 has a sizing scheme that follows their expectations
Some consumers feel that the underfoot experience of this Nike running shoe is reactive enough to permit speedier toe-offs
The generous height of the midsole unit allow for extended running sessions, according to most runners
The aesthetics of this neutral running shoe are praised for being highly appreciable and street-ready
A couple of purchasers welcome the traction capacity of the outsole, likening it to a car tire that can handle the wet and dry ground
cons: Several consumers have complained about the too-soft underfoot experience of the Nike Zoom Fly 3, comparing it to a recovery shoe
A handful of testers have observed the outsole rubber wearing off after only a few months of use
The weight e is subjected to criticism for being a bit heavy for a racing shoe

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for serious running, definitely NOT for anything else
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic shoes for serious runners who know how to run and do it for 45 minutes to multiple hours at a time. Definitely NOT for walking or gym training because the hyper bouncy heel makes the shoe totally unstable for any activity where you put weight on the heel (true runners land somewhere in the middle of the sole so that's prefect for them and very stable in that case). Everything about this shoe feels very high quality, it's quite remarkable.
customer_reviews.author: FLO

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: I'm a larger runner, with foot problems. This is the ONLY shoe that I've found that will let me run 15+ miles a week. It's a step up from the pegasus I was running in.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew G. Mullis

customer_reviews.title: Great runners
customer_reviews.text: Light, bouncy shoe. Easy to run in. I’ve done about 20 miles in these runners in the last two weeks. Great runs. Odd shape of the sole makes these a little weird to walk in, but that’s not what they’re for. Put them on and hit the track or the pavement. Outstanding running shoe. Not very good for anything else. Don’t really care for the looks and you can’t walk around in these, not that you’d want to.
customer_reviews.author: BailJ

customer_reviews.title: Fast Shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 pairs total because I was so impressed with the first one after running a 5K. It might be a placebo effect due to the reviews but somehow my time is a lot faster.
customer_reviews.author: nao

customer_reviews.title: Running
customer_reviews.text: Lots of cushion that helps protect my Achilles. Not as much stability but lots of cushion. Looking forward to buying this years model as well
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: New favorite running shoe
customer_reviews.text: I had ordered these based on all the hype with the new shoes and they do not disappoint. Very comfortable shoe that is fantastic for running in a straight line or on very long curves. I did have to take a PT test on an indoor track that was very short and was scared of rolling my ankles rounding corners, but other than that, these shoes are amazing. I will be getting another pair when these wear out, which may take much longer than I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Perphektxero

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Balance
customer_reviews.text: this shoe has very little stability for anyone who has flat feet, or need a shoe to have a wide mid-sole or heel. very little cushion for michaels of the world with flat feet or wide feet. my feet and shins were hurting so bad i had to buy some better shoes from altra. the altra superiors 4.0 to be specific. those shoes are a much better fit and my knee and shin pain almost instantly healed. Save yourself some money and get the ultra instead
customer_reviews.author: Michael Guillory

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe for long runs
customer_reviews.text: This shoe is weird to walk in, but is really great for long runs. It offers a lot of support and stability. I am a heavier runner, as I stand 6' and 195 lbs, and my feet and knees never hurt after I run in these. If you need the foot and knee support, do not hesitate and pick up a pair.
customer_reviews.author: Archie Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Fells like I’m running on pillows. Probably the best shoe I’ve ever ran in. I typically have a little knee pain on the first quarter mile or so until I’m warmed up and I don’t have that pain when I wear these. The cushion is very soft, and probably too squishy to wear 24/7. Phenomenal running shoe though.
customer_reviews.author: Mama2018

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for heel striker
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for me! Heel striker and I’m definitely on the heavier side, at 250 lbs. these shoes have allowed me to start running again! It’s like walking on clouds! Amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Los

customer_reviews.title: far from vaporfly
customer_reviews.text: Much slower than the Vaporfly. Poor heel stability. Not a racing shoe, but a trainer at most. As a training shoe, I prefer by far the Adidas Ultraboost, that is much more stable.
customer_reviews.author: GMB

customer_reviews.title: These running shoe feel great - paired with NRC, they’re boss!!
customer_reviews.text: Had my first run in these. Wow! Coming from an older Nike I’ve had for awhile, these are boss. They’re made for speed. Talk about a spring in my step, especially coupled with guidance on Nike Run Club App. 😍 them!!
customer_reviews.author: Gregory

customer_reviews.title: Light and cushiony great for lowering impact
customer_reviews.text: Switched from Hoka brand because they were thick and wide. These are plenty thick and cushiony but not half as wide. These shoes are almost as light as my ankle socks.
customer_reviews.author: Amy&Ken

customer_reviews.title: Great ride, for long runs
customer_reviews.text: Great long distance shoe, I hope I can get more than 200 miles (seems to be the most I get out of a pair of Nikes) out of them...remind me of Adidas Boost or Hoka’s...BUT the colors are just horrible, but I am 50, so I understand that the 20-30 year old are the target audience
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nike Zoom Fly 3
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe overall, big improvements! Will use them for short distances and not long runs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing shoe! Speedy service!
customer_reviews.text: I've literally owned over 15 pairs of this same shoe. In my experience, this is the PERFECT running shoe, and I was pumped to find a pair in my size still. The seller also did a fantastic job with prompt next day delivery!
customer_reviews.author: Jason Tierney

customer_reviews.title: BEST RUNNING SHOES I'VE EVER HAD
customer_reviews.text: As soon as I tried them on after they arrived I couldn't wait to have a run in them. You will IMMEDIATELY feel the difference. The sole seems somewhat like a fulcrum. propelling you forward with each step...AWSOME RUNNING SHOES
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves these shoes. They are great to train in.
customer_reviews.author: Thedarksideprincess

customer_reviews.title: Perfection in a shoe
customer_reviews.text: Ordered a men’s 8.5 as it is equivalent to a women’s 10– and oh my gosh, these sneakers are PERFECT. Super soft & light weight- you feel like you’re flying. Even better, they arrived in 3 days! 10/10 would recommend this product & seller.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Noticeably faster
customer_reviews.text: These shoes add speed. They fit like a glove and give that extra spring needed to keep your legs moving on longer runs.
customer_reviews.author: Kory

customer_reviews.title: Great running shoes
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are amazing for running. More money than I am used to spending for running shoes, but well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: donald

customer_reviews.title: Great cushion
customer_reviews.text: Ran my first 5K race today. Great cushion. Felt like I was floating.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Dean

customer_reviews.title: Great performance
customer_reviews.text: My job requires me to do physical fitness everyday. These shoes have definitely helped in my performance and making my cardio days fun.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Feliciano

customer_reviews.title: Soft ride that helps reduce fatigue on long training runs.
customer_reviews.text: A soft but fast ride and a comfortable fit. Great marathon training shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Vince D.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect product and very pleased with delivery to UK! Cheers
customer_reviews.text: Perfect product - My son cherishes these trainers and very pleased with delivery to the UK! Cheers
customer_reviews.author: G Davies

customer_reviews.title: Great For Running
customer_reviews.text: Great comfort and bounce while running, about as good as my old Brooks
customer_reviews.author: Juan

customer_reviews.title: So light and cushy!
customer_reviews.text: So light and cushy AND I like the colors...a lot
customer_reviews.author: PauseBeet

customer_reviews.title: 250? Wow
customer_reviews.text: You can buy these for 127.00 on nike.com with free shipping if you're a member..
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Budget Vaporfly
customer_reviews.text: The zoom fly 3 is truly a budget vaporfly next%. Carbon fiber plate, spongy bouncy feel, etc. Comments about this being a “runner’s” shoe are accurate. If you are an inexperienced recreational runner who likes to do <3 mile runs at a slow pace you may find these shoes to be a bit much (maybe even uncomfortable). If you’re a decent runner currently using something like the Pegasus 35/36 you will most likely start breaking all your PB’s with this shoe. They almost auto-correct your form with the way they encourage you to be more forward leaning with a better foot strike. At ~ $170 I would say these are some of the best shoes on the market.
customer_reviews.author: mark

customer_reviews.title: GREAT SHOES FOR A LARGER MAN
customer_reviews.text: I am 6ft/240lbs I am in the military and run a lot. Usually I try to buy shoes with a lot of cushion. I purchased these shoes at a factory retail store for a great price. The first few times I ran in them, they felt kind of wobbly. Basically, I really had to concentrate on my stride and how I distribute my weight. Once I got the hang of it, the shoes started feeling much better. I can definitely feel the bounce in them. One of the best things is that improving my stride has greatly reduced the post run pain in my knees. Love these shoes! HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!
customer_reviews.author: william zinn

customer_reviews.title: Make sure it’s the right size.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a size 9 U.S men’s and got a massive size 14. :( the shoes looks amazing but the wait and anticipation was a huge let down.
customer_reviews.author: Allen-Riley Meade

product_meta.title: Nike Men's Zoom Fly 3 Running Shoes
product_meta.description: From training to the day of the race. Equipped with a nylon and carbon sole plate, the Nike zoom Fly 3 running shoe is the perfect answer to the needs of the run time, long runs and the most challenging race days. The nylon and carbon sole plate in the midsole ensures maximum forward propulsion to bring you closer to your goal with every step. Lunarlon cushioning combines soft and stiff foam for an ideal balance between shock absorption, stability and responsiveness, without ever sacrificing comfort. The fly mesh upper in one piece, extremely breathable and virtually seamless, is designed to ensure the right freshness on the upper part of the foot when the Ride goes live. The ultra-light flywire cables wrap around the foot when you tighten the laces ensuring a secure fit that follows your every move.
feature_bullets: Full-Length Nike React Midsole For Cushioned Comfort
Lightweight Upper For A Sleek Look And Breathable Feel
Inner Sleeve And Low Collar Profile Fit Your Foot For A Racing Feel
Carbon Fiber Plate In The Midsole Shrinks And Expands For A Flexible Feel"
